section.title: Overview
section.para: This scheme checks the presence of a user's DN in a configured gridmap file. The grid map file contains a list of mappings from a user's DN to set of local user names that the user is mapped to. The DN and the list of comma-separated mappings are separated by a space. Each mapping is a separate new line by itself.

If the user is present in the configured gridmap file, the mappings are populated in the peer subject object as principals and the user is allowed access to the resource. Absence of DN in gridmap file yields a deny.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: The gridmap file location or an instance of GridMap object needs to be configured as a parameter to this PDP. The parameter names are:

listitem.para: To configure the location of the gridmap file. (From CoG add details on how this file is read in, relative to current directory ?)]
To configure an instance of GridMap class.

section.para: The PDP looks for the gridmap file in the following order:

listitem.para: GridMap object property in the configuration.
GridMap file property in the configuration.
GridMap object in the container default properties.

section.para: No interceptors are related other than the default bootstrap interceptor (), which is required to be used with this PDP.
